intro: Cynanchica pyrenaica subsp. neglecta, commonly known as the Pyrenean milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native range.
